text: welcome to this video where we will
demonstrate how to use the aws schema
conversion tool to convert the oracle
database schema to amazon or mysql you
can find the full step-by-step database
migration guide on the aws database
migration service documentation website
this video walks through a specific part
of the database migration project which
is related to database schema conversion
to follow the steps shown in this video
you need to create oracle and amazon
aurora mysql databases the creation of
these objects is out of the scope of
this video
first of all we launch the aws schema
conversion tool and create a new
database migration project
we add a source database and choose
oracle
next we enter the connection name and
credentials
aws sct connected to the source oracle
database
now we add a target database and choose
amazon aurora mysql compatible
we enter the connection name and
credentials
aws sct connected to the target aurora
mysql database
in the source metadata tree we select
the chinook database schema which we
need to convert
we then select the target or rmi sql
database and choose create mapping after
we created the mapping rule aws sct can
convert source oracle database schema to
aurora mysql we switch to the main view
to start the conversion
aws sct highlights the mapped schema in
bold
in the source metadata tree we select
the chinook database schema which we
need to convert
from the context menu we choose create
report
now aws sct analyzes the source database
schema to create an assessment report
this report includes all issues
identified for the current database
migration project and actions to resolve
these issues
aws sct completed the analysis and
displayed the assessment report for
review
you can see that our source oracle
database schema has four objects that
require simple manual conversion actions
aws sct shows all places in the source
code where this action item occurs the
upper area shows a recommended action
for every issue
from the context menu we choose convert
schema
we then agree to override existing
database objects in the target database
after this aws sct starts the conversion
after aws sct completes the conversion
the converted schema appears in the
target metadata tree
we open the context menu in the target
metadata tree and apply the converted
code to the target database
we refresh the target database schema to
make sure that all database objects are
applied
this completes the overview of the
oracle database schema conversion to
amazon aurora my sequel thanks for
watching this video
